New Records: Rohit Sharma reached 200 sixes in T20Is
Rohit Sharma scored the fastest fifty in all T20s
Rohit Sharma made 50 of India's 52 runs, which is a T20I record for the lowest team score when a batter's made a half-century where ball-by-ball data is available
Rohit Sharma hit 8 sixes, the most by an Indian in an innings in the T20 World Cup
Rohit Sharma scored 89 off 37 balls at 10 overs for Rohit, with 76 runs in fours and sixes, hitting a boundary on average once every 2.4 balls
Key Match Events: Virat Kohli fell for a duck off Josh Hazlewood
Travis Head fell to Jasprit Bumrah for 54 off 26
Mitchell Marsh fell to Kuldeep Yadav for 0
Marcus Stoinis fell to Axar Patel for 0
David Warner fell to Arshdeep Singh for 2
Pre-Game Insights: Australia bowl, with Mitchell Starc back in for Ashton Agar
Mitchell Marsh says the game is like a quarter-final for Australia
India's Rohit Sharma says he would've wanted to field too, but the pitch looks really good
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma's masterclass takes India to the semi-finals
India won by 24 runs, with a total of 205/5
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch is the same one used for the England vs South Africa game where 163 was defended
The boundaries are even, approx 60-70m around the park
The weather's a lot cooler, perhaps even enough to suggest a bit of swing in the air, which Mitchell Starc is eminently placed to exploit
